alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Magoffin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Knott, central Floyd, northwestern Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pyramid to Bosco to Betty. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Eastern and Langley around 400 PM EDT. Printer around 405 PM EDT. Martin, Drift, Hunter, Minnie and Alphoretta around 410 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Allen, Dana, Allen City, Beaver Junction, Blue Moon, Arkansas, Dwale, Justell, Banner, Honaker, Betsy Layne, Emma, Alvin, Ivel, Grethel, Aluba, Harold, Osborn, Boldman, Endicott, Pikeville, McCombs and Coal Run. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential downpours are also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways or localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
